page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT, GARAGE
page.content: THE GARAGE IS CALLED 'THE BLACK AND WHITE SERVICE STATION'.IT WAS BUILT IN THE 1940'S.IT SELLS PETROL BUT HAS A LITTLE SHOP FOR SWEETS,TOOLS, CAR-ACCESSORIES,DRINKS,LIGHTERS,GAS, MAPS,OIL AND EVEN TOYS.IT OPENS FROM 7'30 AM UNTIL 8 PM.THE OWNER AND HIS WIFE LIVE IN A BUNGALOW AT THE BACK. THEY HAVE WORKED HERE FOR 26 YEARS. IT IS NOW ALL SELF-SERVICE.ANOTHER CHANGE WAS STREET LIGHTS,PUT UP BY THE GOVERNOR OF NORTHEYE PRISON,TO PREVENT ACCIDENTS,AND DETER CRIME OR PRISONERS ESCAPING.THERE USED TO BE A REPAIR GARAGE NEXT TO IT,BUT THIS NOW HOUSES A CARAVAN.THEIR HOBBY IS CARAVANNING. TOILETS WERE HERE TOO,VERY CLEAN AND WELL LOOKED AFTER. SUMMER-TRAFFIC IS A LOT HEAVIER,AND HE SELLS MORE PETROL THEN.IT IS MOSTLY 4 STAR AT Â£2 PER GALLON,WHICH WOULD TAKE THE AVERAGE CAR ABOUT 30 MILES AT AVERAGE SPEED.
